thread.title: Man Utd team news: Wayne Rooney, Michael Carrick and Phil Jones to miss St Etienne game | Metro News
thread.title_full: Man Utd team news: Wayne Rooney, Michael Carrick and Phil Jones to miss St Etienne game | Metro News

author: Coral Barry For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Man Utd team news: Wayne Rooney, Michael Carrick and Phil Jones to miss St Etienne game | Metro News
text:
Coral Barry for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 2:39 pm Wayne Rooney will not feature against St Etienne (Picture: Getty) 
Jose Mourinho has confirmed Wayne Rooney , Michael Carrick and Phil Jones will all miss the first leg of Manchester United’s last-16 Europa League tie against St Etienne. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
The French side arrive at Old Trafford on Thursday night, but the Red Devils will have to make do without a key trio including their captain, Rooney. 
Carrick and Rooney both made the bench for United’s last game against Watford, but are not fit enough to be involved against St Etienne. 
All three missed Wednesday’s training session. 
‘Phil is still recovering from the injury of the Wigan match,’ said Mourinho in his press conference. Several players missed training on Wednesday (Picture: Getty) Jose Mourinho will be hoping to keep a clean sheet on Thursday (Picture: Getty) 
‘Wayne and Michael are, I don’t want to say injures, because I don’t think we are talking about injuries. 
‘We are speaking about little muscular problem and protection of these problems, so all three are out tomorrow and, apart from that, everything is alright.’ Manchester United fixtures 
St-Etienne – Europa (H) Thu 16 Feb Blackburn – FA Cup (A) – Sat 18 Feb St-Etienne – Europa (A) – Wed 22 Feb Southampton – EFL (N) – Sun 26 Feb Bournemouth (H) – Sat 4 Mar Southampton (A) – Sun 12 Mar Middlesbrough (A) – Sun 19 Mar West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr 
Jones has been missing since a 0-0 draw with Hull City at the start of the month. 
United welcome St Etienne on the back of a 16-game unbeaten run in the Premier League and confident they can bring their domestic form into Europe. 
And Mourinho insisted that despite the fact the Europa League added extra pressure to United’s fixture list, it was still a crucial competition. 
‘We cannot choose competitions at Manchester United,’ he said. Mourinho wants to win the Europa League (Picture: Getty)
